docs.title: Welcome to Projex Documentation🔨 Projex
docs.text: A powerful CLI tool to generate production-ready Python project boilerplates instantly

docs.title: Why Projex?
docs.text: Skip the boring setup and jump straight into coding! Projex generates complete, production-ready project structures with best practices baked in.

docs.title: ⚡ Quick Example
docs.text:
# Install
pip install projex

# Create your project
projex create my-api --template fastapi --db postgresql --auth jwt

# Start coding!
cd my-api
source venv/bin/activate
uvicorn app.main:app --reload

That's it! You now have a production-ready FastAPI project with PostgreSQL and JWT authentication! 🚀

docs.title: ✨ Key Features
docs.text:
• :rocket:{ .lg .middle } 8 Framework Templates

    FastAPI, Django, Flask, Bottle, Pyramid, Tornado, Sanic, CherryPy

    :octicons-arrow-right-24: View Templates

  • :material-database:{ .lg .middle } 5 Database Options

    PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, SQLite, Redis

    :octicons-arrow-right-24: Learn More

  • :material-shield-lock:{ .lg .middle } 4 Auth Methods

    JWT, OAuth2, API Key, Basic Authentication

    :octicons-arrow-right-24: Authentication Guide

  • :material-code-braces:{ .lg .middle } Smart Scaffolding

    Generate models, endpoints, services with one command

    :octicons-arrow-right-24: Scaffolding Docs

  • :material-docker:{ .lg .middle } Docker Ready

    Complete Docker and docker-compose setup included

    :octicons-arrow-right-24: Docker Guide

  • :material-test-tube:{ .lg .middle } Testing Built-in

    pytest configuration with fixtures and examples

    :octicons-arrow-right-24: Testing Guide

  • :octicons-workflow-24:{ .lg .middle } CI/CD Pipelines

    GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, CircleCI configs

    :octicons-arrow-right-24: CI/CD Setup

  • :material-file-document:{ .lg .middle } Documentation Tools

    MkDocs and Sphinx setup included

    :octicons-arrow-right-24: Docs Setup

docs.title: 🚀 Quick Start
docs.text: Get started in 3 easy steps:

docs.title: 1. Install Projex
docs.text:
pipFrom Source 
pip install projex

git clone https://github.com/ChAbdulWahhab/projex.git
cd projex
pip install -e .

docs.title: 2. Create Your Project
docs.text:
Interactive ModeCommand Line 

projex create
The CLI will guide you through the setup with interactive prompts.

projex create my-api --template fastapi --db postgresql

docs.title: 3. Start Development
docs.text:
cd my-api
source venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
uvicorn app.main:app --reload

Visit http://localhost:8000/docs for interactive API documentation! 📚

docs.title: 📋 What Gets Generated?
docs.text:
Every project includes:

✅ Production-ready structure - Best practices baked in ✅ Docker support - Dockerfile and docker-compose ✅ Testing setup - pytest with examples ✅ Environment config - .env file management ✅ Database integration - ORM/ODM configured ✅ Authentication - Ready to use auth system ✅ API documentation - Auto-generated docs ✅ Git initialization - Ready for version control

docs.title: Microservices Architecture
docs.text:
projex create user-service --template fastapi
projex create order-service --template fastapi
projex create payment-service --template fastapi
Learn more about microservices →

docs.title: REST API Development
docs.text:
projex create my-api --template fastapi --db postgresql --auth jwt
cd my-api
projex add cicd --provider github
REST API guide →

docs.title: Full-Stack Application
docs.text:
projex create backend --template fastapi
projex create admin --template django
Full-stack setup →

docs.title: Your First Project
docs.text: Let's build a complete REST API from scratch using Projex!

docs.title: What We'll Build
docs.text: A User Management API with: - User CRUD operations - JWT authentication - PostgreSQL database - Docker support - Tests

docs.title: Step 1: Create Project
docs.text:
projex create user-api \
  --template fastapi \
  --db postgresql \
  --auth jwt \
  --style full \
  --author "Your Name"

What happens: - Creates user-api/ directory - Generates complete project structure - Sets up virtual environment - Initializes git repository - Installs dependencies

docs.title: Step 2: Explore Structure
docs.text:
cd user-api
tree -L 2

You'll see: 

user-api/
├── app/
│   ├── main.py          # Application entry
│   ├── core/            # Config & database
│   ├── api/             # API routes
│   ├── models/          # Database models
│   └── schemas/         # Pydantic schemas
├── tests/               # Test files
├── .env.example         # Environment template
├── Dockerfile           # Docker config
├── docker-compose.yml   # Docker services
├── requirements.txt     # Dependencies
└── README.md            # Project docs

docs.title: Step 3: Configure Environment
docs.text:
# Copy environment template
cp .env.example .env

# Edit with your values
nano .env  # or use any editor

Example .env: 

DATABASE_URL=postgresql://user:pass@localhost:5432/userdb
SECRET_KEY=your-secret-key-here
DEBUG=True
ENVIRONMENT=development

docs.title: Using Docker (Recommended)
docs.text: docker-compose up -d db

docs.title: Or Install PostgreSQL Locally
docs.text:
# Create database
createdb userdb

docs.title: Step 5: Run Migrations
docs.text:
# Activate virtual environment
source venv/bin/activate  # Linux/Mac
venv\Scripts\activate     # Windows

# Run migrations
alembic upgrade head

docs.title: Step 6: Start Server
docs.text:
uvicorn app.main:app --reload

Output: 

INFO:     Uvicorn running on http://127.0.0.1:8000
INFO:     Application startup complete.

docs.title: Visit API Docs
docs.text:
Open browser: http://localhost:8000/docs

You'll see Swagger UI with all endpoints!

docs.title: Test Health Endpoint
docs.text:
curl http://localhost:8000/health

Response: 

{
  "status": "healthy",
  "version": "1.0.0"
}

docs.title: Register User
docs.text:
curl -X POST http://localhost:8000/api/v1/auth/register \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "email": "user@example.com",
    "password": "SecurePass123",
    "name": "John Doe"
  }'

docs.title: Login
docs.text:
curl -X POST http://localhost:8000/api/v1/auth/login \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "email": "user@example.com",
    "password": "SecurePass123"
  }'

Response: 

{
  "access_token": "eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGc...",
  "token_type": "bearer"
}

docs.title: Step 8: Add Custom Endpoint
docs.text:
Let's add a user profile endpoint!

projex add endpoint profile --crud

This generates: - app/api/v1/endpoints/profile.py - Route handlers (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) - Tests

docs.title: Step 9: Add Model
docs.text:
projex add model Post --fields title:str,content:str,author_id:int

This creates: - app/models/post.py - Database model - app/schemas/post.py - Pydantic schemas - Migration file

docs.title: Step 10: Run Tests
docs.text:
# Install dev dependencies
pip install -r requirements-dev.txt

# Run tests
pytest

# With coverage
pytest --cov=app tests/

Output: 

=============== test session starts ===============
collected 12 items

tests/test_main.py ......                   [ 50%]
tests/api/test_users.py ......              [100%]

=============== 12 passed in 2.45s ===============

docs.title: Step 11: Deploy with Docker
docs.text:
# Build and run everything
docker-compose up --build

# Your API is now running in Docker!

docs.title: Step 12: Add CI/CD
docs.text:
projex add cicd --provider github

This creates .github/workflows/ci.yml with: - Automated tests - Linting - Docker build - Deployment ready

docs.title: Enhance Your API
docs.text:
# Add more models
projex add model Comment --fields text:str,post_id:int

# Add services
projex add service email --async

# Add middleware
projex add middleware cors

docs.title: Add Documentation
docs.text:
projex add docs --tool mkdocs
mkdocs serve

docs.title: Environment Management
docs.text:
projex env add staging
projex env add production

docs.title: Code Quality
docs.text:
projex add quality-tools
pre-commit install

docs.title: Database Connection Error
docs.text:
# Check DATABASE_URL in .env
# Ensure PostgreSQL is running
docker-compose up -d db

docs.title: Import Errors
docs.text:
# Activate virtual environment
source venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: Port Already in Use
docs.text:
# Use different port
uvicorn app.main:app --port 8001

docs.title: What You Learned
docs.text: ✅ Created a production-ready FastAPI project ✅ Set up PostgreSQL database ✅ Configured authentication ✅ Added custom endpoints and models ✅ Ran tests ✅ Deployed with Docker ✅ Set up CI/CD

docs.title: Explore More
docs.text:
• All Framework Templates
  • Smart Scaffolding Guide
  • Authentication Options
  • Database Configuration

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.8+ - Required
  • pip - Package manager
  • Git - For version control (optional)

docs.title: From PyPI (Recommended)
docs.text: pip install projex

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
projex --version
# Output: projex, version 4.0.0

projex --help
# Shows all available commands

docs.title: Install from Source
docs.text:
For development or latest features:

# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/ChAbdulWahhab/projex.git
cd projex

# Install in editable mode
pip install -e .

docs.title: Upgrade Projex
docs.text: pip install --upgrade projex

docs.title: Uninstall
docs.text: pip uninstall projex

docs.title: Windows
docs.text:
# Install
pip install projex

# Add to PATH if needed
# Python Scripts folder should be in PATH

docs.title: Linux/Mac
docs.text:
# Install
pip3 install projex

# If permission error
pip3 install --user projex

docs.title: Virtual Environment (Recommended)
docs.text:
# Create virtual environment
python -m venv venv

# Activate
source venv/bin/activate  # Linux/Mac
venv\Scripts\activate     # Windows

# Install
pip install projex

docs.title: Dependencies
docs.text:
Projex automatically installs:

  • click - CLI framework
  • rich - Beautiful terminal output
  • jinja2 - Template engine
  • requests - HTTP library

docs.title: Command not found
docs.text:
# Add Python Scripts to PATH
# Windows: Add C:\Python3X\Scripts to PATH
# Linux/Mac: Add ~/.local/bin to PATH

docs.title: Permission Denied
docs.text:
# Use --user flag
pip install --user projex

docs.title: SSL Certificate Error
docs.text:
# Use trusted host
pip install --trusted-host pypi.org --trusted-host files.pythonhosted.org projex

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Quick Start Guide
  • Create Your First Project

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Get up and running with Projex in under 5 minutes!

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: pip install projex

docs.title: Interactive Mode (Easiest)
docs.text:
projex create

The CLI will ask you:

  1. Project name? → Enter your project name
  2. Framework? → Choose from 8 options
  3. Database? → Select database type
  4. Authentication? → Pick auth method
  5. Template style? → Choose minimal/standard/full

docs.title: Command Line Mode
docs.text: projex create my-api --template fastapi --db postgresql --auth jwt

docs.title: FastAPI Example
docs.text:
# Navigate to project
cd my-api

# Activate virtual environment
source venv/bin/activate  # Linux/Mac
venv\Scripts\activate     # Windows

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Run development server
uvicorn app.main:app --reload

Visit http://localhost:8000/docs for API documentation!

docs.title: Django Example
docs.text:
cd my-site
source venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
python manage.py migrate
python manage.py runserver

Visit http://localhost:8000/admin

docs.title: Flask Example
docs.text:
cd my-app
source venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
python run.py

Visit http://localhost:5000

docs.title: What You Get
docs.text:
Every project includes:

✅ Complete project structure ✅ Docker & docker-compose ✅ Testing setup (pytest) ✅ Environment configuration ✅ Database integration ✅ Authentication (if selected) ✅ Git initialization ✅ Best practices

docs.title: Common Commands
docs.text:
# List available templates
projex list

# Get help
projex --help
projex create --help

# Skip options
projex create my-app --template flask --no-git --no-venv

docs.title: Add Components
docs.text:
# Add a model
projex add model User --fields name:str,email:str

# Add CRUD endpoint
projex add endpoint users --crud

# Add CI/CD
projex add cicd --provider github

docs.title: Environment Setup
docs.text:
# Create environment files
projex env add development
projex env add production

# Copy example env
cp .env.example .env
# Edit .env with your values

docs.title: Docker
docs.text:
# Start with docker-compose
docker-compose up --build

docs.title: Tips
docs.text: 💡 Use --style minimal for learning 💡 Use --style full for production 💡 Check generated README.md for project-specific instructions 💡 Run tests from day one: pytest

docs.title: Port Already in Use
docs.text:
# FastAPI
uvicorn app.main:app --port 8001

# Django
python manage.py runserver 8001

# Flask
flask run --port 5001

docs.title: Import Errors
docs.text:
# Ensure virtual environment is active
source venv/bin/activate

# Reinstall dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt
